name: Pawpaw Bread
author: Amaranth
summary: A wonderful fruit bread made from the largest edible fruit native to America. Ripe in the fall, this tropical fruit grows right here in the USA. Pawpaw can be used in many recipes calling for bananas.
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Grease the bottom of an 8-inch loaf pan with cooking spray
Combine sugar and butter in a bowl; beat together until smooth
Add pawpaw pulp and water; beat until combined, about 30 seconds
Stir in flour, walnuts, baking soda, salt, and baking powder
Pour into the prepared loaf pan
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 1 hour 15 minutes
Allow to cool before slicing, about 30 minutes
